msContents.summary: A small part from the Nāradīyapurāṇa. It is believed that this text contains around 2000v 2 verses from the Nāradīyapurāṇa but some variations regarding the actual number of verses is found. One text of the Haribhaktisudhodaya is published with translation into Bengali and is in bengali script.

msItem.title: Haribhaktisudhodaya of Nāradīyapurāṇa

filiation.p: Notices of Sanskrit Manuscripts Vol. XIII: p 231, Ms 265 Sharada Oriental Series no 1: XIII Delhi. ignca.nic.in//Asi_data//78093.pdf Aufrecht Catalogus vol. 1 p. 758

msItem.incipit: ekaṁ yajjanayatyanekatanubhṛt śasyānyajalaṁ mitho bhinnākāraguṇāni kaiścidapi vā noptaṁ na siktaṁ jalaiḥ
msItem.explicit:

msItem.finalRubric:
iti nāradiye purāṇe haribhaktisuyodaye viṁśodhyāyaḥ ௳ śrikṛṣṇāya paramātmane

support.p: Thin palm leaves are used as guard folio. First guard folio is preserved with think red colored twine.

extent.measure: 2 guard folios, 3 blank folios, 91 written folios

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numerals in the left margin.
supportDesc.condition: Initial folio are broken. Corners are torn. Many folios are worm eaten.

handNote.desc: Written clean, sometimes strokes are mixed with the other letters.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṁ śubhamastu is written in the left margin followed by folio number.
haribhakti is written in the left margin.

Sudhodaya Nāradīya is written in Devanagari script on the front guard cover with the number III in the left side of the folio and number 4 written with the blue pencil at the centre of the folio and same number with the pink pencil in the left side of the folio.
Sticker of number 43 is glued on the front guard folio.

listBibl.bibl: Hari Bhakti Sudhodaya (with Bengali Translation) Shri Ramnarayana Vidyaratna Berhampur, Murshidabad. June 1894.

encodingDesc.p: Question mark is used to show illegible characters.
